definition: to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: Germans became quickly known for their fetish movies.
sentences.chinese: 之後德國的戀物癖電影迅速揚名世界。

sentences.english: From costumes to fetish play, I will do it all.
sentences.chinese: 從服裝到戀物癖發揮，我將盡一切。

sentences.english: On the other hand, fetishes are extremely rare among women.
sentences.chinese: 在另一方面，戀物癖在女性之間卻極爲罕見。

sentences.english: He is shown meeting other enthusiasts at a rally in California
sentences.chinese: 他在銀幕上出現使其他戀物癖者在加利福尼亞州集會。

sentences.english: Adding sexual arousal and gratification to the dynamic, we have fetishes or paraphilias.
sentences.chinese: 增加人的性喚醒和滿足感，我們有戀物癖。

definition: richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
to keep up with the latest fashion
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
